item.title: DeepSeek halts new signups amid "large-scale" cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Chinese AI platform DeepSeek has disabled registrations on it DeepSeek-V3 chat platform due to an ongoing "large-scale" cyberattack targeting its services. [...]

item.title: Bitwarden makes it harder to hack password vaults without MFA
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Open-source password manager Bitwarden is adding an extra layer of security for accounts that are not protected by two-factor authentication, requiring email verification before allowing access to accounts. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: January Windows security updates break audio playback
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has confirmed that the January 2025 Windows security updates are breaking audio playback on some systems with external DACs (digital-to-analog converters). [...]

item.title: Apple fixes this year’s first actively exploited zero-day bug
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Apple has released security updates to fix this year's first zero-day vulnerability, tagged as actively exploited in attacks targeting iPhone users. [...]

item.title: EU sanctions Russian GRU hackers for cyberattacks against Estonia
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The European Union sanctioned three hackers, part of Unit 29155 of Russia's military intelligence service (GRU), for their involvement in cyberattacks targeting Estonia's government agencies in 2020. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 24H2 preview brings new taskbar features
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Windows 11 taskbar is testing a new feature that helps you understand the current power state of your laptop's battery, including showing the battery percentage directly on the taskbar. [...]

item.title: Hackers steal $85 million worth of cryptocurrency from Phemex
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Phemex crypto exchange suffered a massive security breach on Thursday where threat actors stole over $85 million worth of cryptocurrency. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Teams phishing attack alerts coming to everyone next month
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft reminded Microsoft 365 admins that its new brand impersonation protection feature for Teams Chat will be available for all customers by mid-February 2025. [...]

item.title: Clone2Leak attacks exploit Git flaws to steal credentials
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A set of three distinct but related attacks, dubbed 'Clone2Leak,' can leak credentials by exploiting how Git and its credential helpers handle authentication requests. [...]

item.title: UnitedHealth now says 190 million impacted by 2024 data breach
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: UnitedHealth has revealed that 190 million Americans had their personal and healthcare data stolen in the Change Healthcare ransomware attack, nearly doubling the previously disclosed figure. [...]

item.title: Ransomware gang uses SSH tunnels for stealthy VMware ESXi access
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Ransomware actors targeting ESXi bare metal hypervisors are leveraging SSH tunneling to persist on the system while remaining undetected. [...]

item.title: TalkTalk investigates breach after data for sale on hacking forum
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: UK telecommunications company TalkTalk is investigating a third-party supplier data breach after a threat actor began selling alleged customer data on a hacking forum. [...]

item.title: PayPal to pay $2 million settlement over 2022 data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: New York State has announced a $2,000,000 settlement with PayPal over charges it failed to comply with the state's cybersecurity regulations, leading to a 2022 data breach. [...]
